column1: It is not often (out of a fairy tale) that wishes to change the whole current of one's life are granted so promptly as that wish of mine was.The next morning's post brought a letter from Mrs. Arkwright. They were staying in the south of England
column3: and heard all their news. It was an important budget. They were going abroad once more
column4: and it had been arranged between my two guardians that I was to remain in England for my education
column5: and that my home was to be—with Eleanor. Matilda was to go with her parents; to the benefit
column7: of her health. Aunt Theresa sent me the kindest messages
column8: and promised to write to me. Matilda sent her love to us both."And the day after to-morrow they come home!" Eleanor announced.
